conclusion: Determine if the difference in speed between objects A and B continuously increases over the time interval from 0 to t1.
Both objects start at rest, so their initial speeds are 0.
v_A(t) reaches its maximum before t1; v_B(t) reaches its maximum after v_A(t) and at a lower value.
Both v_A(t) and v_B(t) decrease to zero again by t1.
Difference in speed Δv(t) can be positive, negative, or zero depending on the relative positions of the two curves.
Rate of change of Δv(t) depends on the slopes of v_A(t) and v_B(t).
When both slopes are positive, Δv(t) could increase if v_A(t) increases faster than v_B(t).
When both slopes are negative, Δv(t) could decrease if v_A(t) decreases slower than v_B(t).
Slopes of v_A(t) and v_B(t) do not remain constant, so Δv(t) will not necessarily continuously increase or decrease.
There will be instances where the difference in speed changes direction.
The difference in speed between the two objects does not continuously increase over the time interval from 0 to t1.
